attributes.action: Yemen Conflict: UK must stop arming Saudi Arabia
attributes.additional_details: The UK government is complicit in the humanitarian crisis in Yemen as it is still exporting weapons to the Saudi-Arabian led coalition (SLC). The court of appeal found that the export of British arms sales to Saudi Arabia to be unlawful as it had not properly assessed whether air-strikes that killed civilians in Yemen broke humanitarian law. Despite this verdict the UK government has managed to find a loop-hole by allowing already-registered companies to continue exporting.
attributes.background: For the UK government to suspend the provision of weapons, military training and support, and diplomatic cover for the Saudi-led coalition, which has helped fuel the largest humanitarian crisis in 100 years.
